verses.verse: And so it is written, (Gen. 2:7) “The first man Adam became a living being.” ((Rom. 5:14)) The last Adam became (John 5:21; 6:57; (Rom. 8:2; Phil. 3:21; Col. 3:4)) a life-giving spirit.
However, the spiritual is not first, but the natural, and afterward the spiritual.
(John 3:31) The first man was of the earth, (Gen. 2:7; 3:19) made of dust; the second Man is the Lord (John 3:13) from heaven.
As was the man of dust, so also are those who are made of dust; (Phil. 3:20) and as is the heavenly Man, so also are those who are heavenly.
And (Gen. 5:3) as we have borne the image of the man of dust, (Rom. 8:29; (2 Cor. 3:18; Phil. 3:21; 1 John 3:2)) we shall also bear the image of the heavenly Man.
(Our Final Victory) Now this I say, brethren, that (Matt. 16:17; (John 3:3, 5)) flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; nor does corruption inherit incorruption.
Behold, I tell you a mystery: ((1 Thess. 4:15)) We shall not all sleep, ((Phil. 3:21)) but we shall all be changed—
in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. (Zech. 9:14; Matt. 24:31; John 5:25) For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and (2 Cor. 5:4) this mortal must put on immortality.

So when this corruptible has put on incorruption, and this mortal has put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written: (Is. 25:8; (Rev. 20:14)) “Death is swallowed up in victory.”
“O (Hos. 13:14) Death, where is your sting? O Hades, where is your victory?”
The sting of death is sin, and ((Rom. 3:20; 4:15; 7:8)) the strength of sin is the law.
((Rom. 7:25); 2 Cor. 2:14) But thanks be to God, who gives us (Rom. 8:37; (Heb. 2:14; 1 John 5:4); Rev. 21:4) the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
(2 Pet. 3:14) Therefore, my beloved brethren, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing ((1 Cor. 3:8)) that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.
(Collection for the Saints) Now concerning (Acts 11:29; Gal. 2:10) the collection for the saints, as I have given orders to the churches of Galatia, so you must do also:
(Acts 20:7) On the first day of the week let each one of you lay something aside, storing up as he may prosper, that there be no collections when I come.
And when I come, (2 Cor. 3:1; 8:18) whomever you approve by your letters I will send to bear your gift to Jerusalem.
(2 Cor. 8:4, 19) But if it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me.
(Personal Plans) Now I will come to you (Acts 19:21; 2 Cor. 1:15, 16) when I pass through Macedonia (for I am passing through Macedonia).
And it may be that I will remain, or even spend the winter with you, that you may (Acts 15:3; Rom. 15:24; 1 Cor. 16:11) send me on my journey, wherever I go.
For I do not wish to see you now on the way; but I hope to stay a while with you, (Acts 18:21; James 4:15) if the Lord permits.
But I will tarry in Ephesus until (Lev. 23:15-22) Pentecost.
For (Acts 14:27; 2 Cor. 2:12; Col. 4:3) a great and effective door has opened to me, and (Acts 19:9) there are many adversaries.
And (Acts 19:22; 2 Tim. 1:2) if Timothy comes, see that he may be with you without fear; for (Phil. 2:20; 1 Thess. 3:2) he does the work of the Lord, as I also do.
